channel.title: CyberNetSec - Cloud Security
channel.description: Latest cloud security threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Weaponized Invites: Google Gemini Flaw Allows Calendar Data Theft via Prompt Injection
item.description:
Security researchers from Miggo Security have uncovered a significant vulnerability in Google Gemini's integration with Google Calendar. The flaw allowed attackers to use an indirect prompt injection technique to exfiltrate summaries of private meetings. By sending a specially crafted calendar invit...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Warning: Malicious Chrome Extensions Hijack Workday, NetSuite Sessions to Bypass MFA
item.description:
Security researchers have uncovered five malicious Google Chrome extensions that impersonate legitimate add-ons for popular enterprise SaaS applications like Workday and NetSuite. The extensions are designed to perform session hijacking by stealing active session cookies and tokens after a user logs...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Data Breach, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: 2025 in Review: Simple Errors, Not 0-Days, Caused Biggest Breaches
item.description:
A year-end analysis of 2025's major data breaches reveals a recurring theme: fundamental security failures, not sophisticated zero-day exploits, were the primary cause. The report, published on December 26, 2025, highlights cloud security misconfigurations and third-party supply chain attacks as the...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: ColorTokens Xshield Platform Gains FedRAMP Moderate Authorization, Boosting Federal Zero Trust Adoption
item.description:
ColorTokens has achieved FedRAMP Moderate Authorization for its Xshield microsegmentation platform, a significant milestone that makes the solution readily available to U.S. federal agencies via the FedRAMP Marketplace. This authorization validates Xshield's security posture and enables government b...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Cloud Security, Security Operations

item.title: JumpCloud Unveils AI-Powered Tools to Govern Shadow AI and Manage Autonomous Agents
item.description:
JumpCloud has introduced a suite of AI-powered capabilities for its identity and access management (IAM) platform, designed to help organizations manage the security risks of modern AI adoption. The new features focus on discovering and governing 'shadow AI'—the unsanctioned use of AI tools by emplo...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Cloud Security, Security Operations

item.title: Acronis Debuts S3-Compatible Archival Storage for MSPs with Predictable Pricing
item.description:
Acronis has launched Acronis Archival Storage, a new long-term, S3-compatible cold storage solution aimed at Managed Service Providers (MSPs) and their SMB clients. Powered by Seagate's Lyve Cloud, the service is integrated into the Acronis Cyber Protect Cloud platform and features a predictable pri...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Cloud Security, Policy and Compliance, Other

Read Full Article →

item.title: AWS Patches 'CodeBreach' Flaw, Averting Massive GitHub Supply Chain Attack
item.description:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) has remediated a critical vulnerability in its AWS CodeBuild service, dubbed 'CodeBreach' by Wiz researchers. The flaw, which stemmed from a misconfigured webhook filter, could have allowed unauthenticated attackers to inject malicious code into the build processes of major...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Cloud Security, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: Massive Unsecured Database Leaks Personal, Health, and Financial Data of 45 Million French Citizens
item.description:
Security researchers have discovered a massive, unprotected database on a cloud server containing the sensitive records of approximately 45 million French citizens. The data, which has since been secured, appears to be an aggregation from at least five separate breaches, compiled by a data broker or...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: VoidLink: New Modular Linux Malware Framework Discovered Targeting Cloud and Container Environments
item.description:
Security researchers at Check Point have discovered 'VoidLink,' a highly sophisticated and modular Linux malware framework. Written in the modern Zig programming language, VoidLink is purpose-built for espionage in cloud and containerized environments. It can detect if it's running in AWS, GCP, Azur...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Cloud Security, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Microsoft Copilot Flaw Allowed Data Theft via "Reprompt" Session Hijacking Attack
item.description:
Researchers discovered a significant vulnerability in Microsoft's Copilot AI assistant that allowed for a "Reprompt" attack, enabling threat actors to bypass safety features, hijack user sessions, and exfiltrate data. The flaw, which has been patched in the January 2026 security update, abused URL p...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Other
